title: Yanchen Jiang (Jeff Jiang)
text:
Hello! My name is Yanchen Jiang (I also use the name Jeff Jiang).
I’m a second year Computer Science PhD candidate at Harvard University, advised by Professor David Parkes and Professor Yiling Chen. My research interests lie in leveraging machine learning to study EconCS, decision-making, and multi-agent AI.
I obtained my Bachelor’s degree from Harvard University in 2022, with a major (joint concentration) in Computer Science and Mathematics and a minor (secondary) in Statistics.
I have been the Head TA of Harvard’s CS136: Economics and Computation in Fall 2023, and a TA for the same course (CS136) in Fall 2021.
You can find more information about current projects I’m working on and prior academic publications on the Publications & Projects page and my contact information.

title: Contact Information
text:

title: Publications & Projects
text:
Academic Publications

2. Strategy-Proof Multi-Bidder Auctions Through Deep Learning , Tonghan Wang*, Yanchen Jiang* , David C. Parkes. Accepted at the Twenty-Fifth ACM Conference on Economics and Computation (EC’24) (2024). Preprint (soon to come).
